poem:
**The Whisper of Pages**

In the hushed  
quiver of text -  
no metaphor can  
capture the shiver  
of skin against skin,  
yet here in  
this morning's  
paper, the ink  
sheds its gravity  
and becomes  
the tender brush  
that colors  
our ordinary  
hearts anew,  
a love scene  
etched with  
careful strokes.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ordinary Love by Marie Rutkoski review – some of the best sex scenes I’ve read this year Sex is notoriously difficult to write. Some authors avoid it entirely; even those who have been called great can come a cropper. Which is why I want to start this review by saying that the sex scenes in Ordinary Love are some of the best I have read this year, and that Marie Rutkoski has a facility for writing". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Ordinary Love by Marie Rutkoski review – some of the best sex scenes I’ve read this year Sex is notoriously difficult to write. Some authors avoid it entirely; even those who have been called great can come a cropper.
